result.execSummary:
The defendant Rigoberto Tanguma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

records.addlTxt: of Convictiion
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (12/21/2018)

1:32 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Kari Stockwell present in court.  Court goes over monies due.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant.  Statement by Agent Stockwell, it should be noted that one case has been paid in full.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court orders defendant to pay $100 each and every month and if not, defendant to spend 1 week in the county jail, starting in December.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:38 p.m.
Probation review hearing on November 6, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
10:12 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to Count 2 Battery and will dismiss and read-in counts 1 & 3.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 2 as charged and orders counts 1 & 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $698.00.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Court adjourned at 10:19 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-21-2015 09:30 am

2:14 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer and has discussed with the defendant but he was not able to get off of work today.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on December 21, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:15 p.m.
Summary of Restitution w/attachment - $698.00
Status hearing at 11-10-2015 01:30 pm

11:05 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - waiting on Discovery.  Court sets for Status Hearing on November 10, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 11:06 a.m.

NO Violent or Abusive Contact with Jose H.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription

2:42 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant qualifies for PD representation and will be representing the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  NO Violent or Abusive Contact with Jose H.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on Status Hearing on October 27, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:44 p.m.
